item.title: How the Gordon-MIT Engineering Leadership Program is Developing Tomorrow's Engineering Leaders
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
32
Location Description: 
Stata Center, Building 32 - Rooms 124 and 144
Sponsor: 
Gordon Engineering Leadership Program
Format: 
booths
Max Participants: 
20
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

In the Gordon-MIT Engineering Leadership Program, MIT engineering undergraduate students learn how to become next-generation technical leaders who have the professional and interpersonal skills to understand and address significant engineering problems in real-world situations.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: MIT Museum Inside Out
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
N52
Location Description: 
MIT Museum
Sponsor: 
Museum
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Free admission all day at the MIT Museum, as it turns itself inside out for the Institute's Open House Day (and the first day of the Cambridge Science Festival!). Go behind the scenes of the Museum and explore unique artifacts from MIT's history, as well as innovations in art, science and technology in Cambridge and beyond. The day's programs will feature tours, hands-on activities, and a chance for visitors of all ages to see and chat with the people behind the Museum's MIT 150 exhibition.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Confronting the Climate Change Challenge
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
56
Location Description: 
Building 56, Outside
Sponsor: 
MIT
Format: 
children's activity
demonstration
exhibit
games
hands-on activity
social media
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Come learn about the science and the policy of climate change! Hands-on activities and demonstrations will help you visualize the current state of climate knowledge and what Earth will look like when MIT is 300 years old. Students and researchers from a wide range of expertise will be on hand to answer questions and discuss global change issues.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: How Computers Work - A Science on Saturday-style technology demonstration.
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 13:00
Location: 
32
Location Description: 
Stata Center, Building 32 - Room 123, Kirsch Auditorium
Sponsor: 
Lincoln Laboratory
Format: 
children's activity
class
demonstration
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
4
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

How do computes use binary numbers? What are AND and OR gates? Why do computers have built-in clocks to time each step the computer makes? In this presentation, we will learn about how computers work, how to get them to do what we want, and how to make them go faster.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Robotics Demonstration
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 14:00
Location: 
W34
Location Description: 
Building W34, Johnson Athletics Center
Sponsor: 
Lincoln Laboratory
Format: 
class
demonstration
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
10
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Unmanned systems are increasingly used to perform tasks that are too dull, dirty, or dangerous for humans. Presently, many of these robotic systems operating in unstructured real-world environments are remotely controlled by human operators. Lincoln Laboratory is developing software, algorithms, and payloads to increase unmanned system autonomy and enable new capabilities. At today's event, we are showing some of Lincoln s unmanned platforms and robot sensors. Additionally, a video presentation will illustrate the autonomous algorithms in action.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Real-Time Voice Transformation
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 10:00 - 15:00
Location: 
4
Location Description: 
Building 4 - Room 149
Sponsor: 
Lincoln Laboratory
Format: 
demonstration
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
25
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

The Human Language Technology Group at Lincoln Laboratory will demonstrate a real-time voice transformation system that can change a persons s voice. For example, a child s voice can be changed to sound like an adult or a female voice can be changed to sound like a male. Volunteers from the audience will test the system with their voices.

Target Age Group: All ages
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Speaker and Language Identification
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 10:00 - 14:00
Location: 
4
Location Description: 
Building 4 - Room 145
Sponsor: 
Lincoln Laboratory
Format: 
children's activity
demonstration
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
25
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

The Human Language Technology Group from Lincoln Laboratory will demonstrate systems that can automatically determine who is speaking and what language is being spoken. Volunteers from the audience will pass the microphone around to each other, and the system will determine, in near real-time, who is talking as well as the language being spoken.

Target Age Group: 5 years to adult
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Microsystems in Action
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
32
Location Description: 
Stata Center, Building 32, Dreyfoos Tower
Sponsor: 
Microsystems Technology Laboratories
Format: 
demonstration
hands-on activity
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Learn how the chips in your cell phone, video game, etc., are made. Take a window tour of the "lab", to see the big machines that it takes to make these tiny devices (tours are limited to 10 people each; there will be four 20-min tours); see demonstrations of new applications (e.g., light emitters, medical measurements).
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: GAMBIT Game Lab Open House
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
NE25
Location Description: 
Building NE25 - Room 319, GAMBIT Game Lab
Sponsor: 
Comparative Media Studies
Format: 
games
hands-on activity
open facility to visitors
tour
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

It s playtime at the Singapore-MIT GAMBIT Game Lab! Find out what a game research lab does: take a tour of the lab, talk to its researchers and developers who spend their days pushing the envelope of video game innovation, and, of course, play our latest game prototypes. For a preview, go to gambit.mit.edu to play our online games. See you Saturday. Game on!
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: How Students with Disabilities Successfully Navigate a University Education.
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 13:00 - 15:00
Location: 
N42
Location Description: 
Building N42, Demo Center
Sponsor: 
Undergraduate Advising and Academic Programming
Format: 
demonstration
open facility to visitors
panel discussion
Max Participants: 
25
Family Friendly: 
no

This informal presentation will provide a forum for parents and students to learn how students with disabilities access and succeed in a highly competitive university. Current MIT students will share their personal experiences, challenges, and successes. Assistive technology will also be demonstrated. Complementing this presentation will be the Open House of MIT's Adaptive Technology Lab.
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Celebrating Discovery at MIT: An Undergraduate Research Poster Session
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 14:00 - 16:00
Location: 
W33
Location Description: 
Building W33, Rockwell Cage
Sponsor: 
Undergraduate Advising and Academic Programming
Format: 
poster session
Max Participants: 
100
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Since 1969, the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program, commonly known as “UROP,” has been facilitating research collaborations between faculty and students, across all disciplines. Today, UROP is considered MIT’s “signature” program, and more than 85% of undergraduates participate.

read more
item.dc:creator: administrator

item.title: Aviation and the Environment
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
33
Location Description: 
Building 33 - Room 115
Sponsor: 
Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

See how, over time, aviation has affected our environment and how MIT researchers are developing ways to make aviation greener. Displays of potential alternative fuel sources, aviation history, maps of Boston-area aviation noise impacts, and more.

Building E40 - Room 298
Sponsor:

Format: 
exhibit

Watch a video about the MIT Engineering Systems Division, talk to students and staff, and take some ESD materials. There also will be videos about and info tables for the Leaders for Global Operations program and the MIT Portugal Program.

item.title: Nuclear Science and Engineering Open House
item.description:
Time: 
Sat, 04/30/2011 - 11:00 - 16:00
Location: 
24
Location Description: 
Building 24 - Rooms 110, 112, 115 and 121
Sponsor: 
Department of Nuclear Science and Engineering
Format: 
demonstration
exhibit
hands-on activity
Max Participants: 
40
Family Friendly: 
Child and Family Friendly

Come visit us and see a cloud chamber that shows how radiation is all around us, a demonstration of a fusion reactor, an online time-of-flight experiment that uses the MIT reactor, and an exploration of the periodic table with examples of each element.
